meanings.definition: A type of coral that forms large colonies.
meanings.sent1: The madrepores in the ocean create beautiful reefs.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the growth patterns of madrepores to understand coral ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The madrepores had a party and invited all the fish to join them.
meanings.sent4: The madrepores stood together like an army of tiny warriors protecting the sea floor.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant colors of the madrepores make them a stunning sight underwater.

meanings.definition: The hard, calcareous skeleton of a madrepore coral.
meanings.sent1: Divers admire the intricate structures of madrepores on the seabed.
meanings.sent2: The madrepores' skeletons provide a sturdy foundation for other marine life.
meanings.sent3: The madrepores' skeletons were so tough, even the strongest waves couldn't break them.
meanings.sent4: The madrepores' skeletons gleamed in the sunlight like precious jewels.
meanings.sent5: Touching the rough surface of the madrepores' skeletons, the diver felt the history of the ocean.

meanings.definition: The polyps of a madrepore coral.
meanings.sent1: Tiny fish seek shelter among the swaying madrepores.
meanings.sent2: The polyps of madrepores extend their tentacles to catch passing plankton.
meanings.sent3: The polyps of the madrepores played hide and seek with the curious seahorses.
meanings.sent4: The polyps of the madrepores danced in the currents like graceful ballerinas.
meanings.sent5: Watching the polyps of the madrepores feed, the marine biologist marveled at nature's wonders.
